articles.title: First sick children have left Gaza for UK - Cooper
articles.summary: The Foreign Office says the group of children will arrive in the UK "in the coming days".
articles.content:
First sick children have left Gaza for UK - Cooper

A Foreign Office source told the BBC the report was correct and the children were due to arrive in the UK in the "coming days".

Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper confirmed the children had been evacuated from Gaza in an interview with the Daily Mirror newspaper.

They are the first children to be brought to the UK for treatment as part of a government operation being co-ordinated by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office, Home Office and Department of Health.

The first group of critically ill and injured Palestinian children set to receive NHS treatment have left Gaza and are expected to arrive in the UK in days.

The UK government is also working to evacuate students with places to study at British universities.

Cooper did not confirm how large the first group was but the BBC understands it contains between 30 and 50 Palestinian children.

Each child could be accompanied by family members if necessary, according to the Mirror.

Cooper told the newspaper "it was a lot of diplomatic work in order to help them actually leave Gaza".

She added: "But that work is underway and I'm determined to make sure that we can do our bit to help those injured families and also to help students get into their courses this autumn."

Some Gazan children have been brought privately to the UK for medical treatment through an initiative by Project Pure Hope, but the government until now had not evacuated any through its own scheme during the conflict.

On Saturday, the Hamas-run health ministry in Gaza said the bodies of 47 people killed by the Israeli military had arrived at its hospitals over the previous day.

Since UN-backed global food security experts confirmed a famine in Gaza City on 22 August, the ministry has reported that at least 142 people have died from starvation and malnutrition across the territory.

Earlier this year, the World Health Organization said that Israel's offensive in Gaza had stretched the territory's health system "beyond breaking point".

Israel has said it is expanding its efforts to facilitate aid deliveries and has disputed the health ministry's figures on malnutrition-related deaths.

The Israeli military launched its campaign in Gaza in response to the Hamas-led attack on southern Israel on 7 October 2023, in which about 1,200 people were killed and 251 others were taken hostage.

At least 64,803 people have been killed in Israeli attacks in Gaza since then, according to the territory's health ministry.

articles.personality_title: First sick children evacuated from Gaza to UK for NHS care
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Gaza has been facing a severe health crisis due to ongoing conflict and shortages of food and medical supplies. Many children there are seriously ill or injured and need urgent medical help.

**What happened** – The UK government has arranged for the first group of critically ill and injured Palestinian children to leave Gaza and come to the UK for treatment under the National Health Service (NHS). This group is expected to arrive in the coming days and may include between 30 and 50 children. Some children may be accompanied by family members.

**Impact** – This evacuation is the first time the UK has brought children from Gaza for medical care during the current conflict. It shows a coordinated effort by several UK government departments to provide vital help to vulnerable children who cannot get the care they need at home. It also offers hope to families and supports students from Gaza who plan to study in the UK.

**What's next step** – The children will receive treatment from NHS hospitals once they arrive. The UK government is also working on evacuating students from Gaza who have been accepted by British universities for the upcoming school year. This operation may continue to help more people affected by the conflict.

**One-sentence takeaway** – The UK has begun bringing critically ill children from Gaza to receive NHS treatment, marking a key step in humanitarian support amid ongoing conflict.
articles.personality_title_fr: Premiers enfants malades évacués de Gaza vers le Royaume-Uni pour soins
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – Gaza traverse une grave crise sanitaire due au conflit en cours et au manque de nourriture et de soins médicaux. De nombreux enfants sont gravement malades ou blessés et ont besoin d'aide urgente.

**Ce qui s'est passé** – Le gouvernement britannique a organisé l'évacuation du premier groupe d'enfants palestiniens gravement malades ou blessés depuis Gaza vers le Royaume-Uni pour être soignés par le Service national de santé (NHS). Ce groupe devrait arriver dans les prochains jours et comprend entre 30 et 50 enfants, accompagnés parfois de membres de leur famille.

**Impact** – C'est la première fois que le Royaume-Uni accueille des enfants de Gaza pour des soins médicaux depuis le début du conflit actuel. Cela montre une action coordonnée des ministères britanniques pour aider des enfants vulnérables qui ne peuvent pas être soignés chez eux. Cela apporte aussi un soutien aux familles et aux étudiants de Gaza qui souhaitent étudier au Royaume-Uni.

**Prochaine étape** – Les enfants recevront des soins dans les hôpitaux du NHS à leur arrivée. Le gouvernement britannique travaille aussi à évacuer des étudiants de Gaza acceptés dans des universités britanniques pour la rentrée. Cette opération pourrait continuer pour aider plus de personnes touchées par le conflit.

**Résumé en une phrase** – Le Royaume-Uni commence à accueillir des enfants gravement malades de Gaza pour des soins NHS, une étape importante d’aide humanitaire pendant le conflit.
articles.personality_title_es: Primeros niños enfermos evacuados de Gaza al Reino Unido para tratamiento NHS
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Gaza enfrenta una grave crisis sanitaria debido al conflicto en curso y la falta de alimentos y atención médica. Muchos niños están gravemente enfermos o heridos y necesitan ayuda urgente.

**Qué pasó** – El gobierno del Reino Unido ha organizado la evacuación del primer grupo de niños palestinos gravemente enfermos o heridos desde Gaza hacia el Reino Unido para recibir tratamiento en el Servicio Nacional de Salud (NHS). Se espera que este grupo llegue en los próximos días y puede incluir entre 30 y 50 niños, algunos acompañados por familiares.

**Impacto** – Esta evacuación es la primera vez que el Reino Unido trae niños de Gaza para atención médica durante el conflicto actual. Muestra un esfuerzo coordinado de varios departamentos del gobierno británico para ayudar a niños vulnerables que no pueden recibir atención en casa. También ofrece esperanza a las familias y apoya a estudiantes de Gaza que planean estudiar en el Reino Unido.

**Próximo paso** – Los niños recibirán tratamiento en hospitales del NHS cuando lleguen. El gobierno del Reino Unido también trabaja para evacuar a estudiantes de Gaza que han sido aceptados en universidades británicas para el próximo año escolar. Esta operación podría continuar para ayudar a más personas afectadas por el conflicto.

**Resumen en una frase** – El Reino Unido ha comenzado a traer niños gravemente enfermos de Gaza para recibir tratamiento en el NHS, marcando un paso importante en el apoyo humanitario en medio del conflicto.
